The Tubbataha Reef National Marine Park in the Philippines is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to over 600 species of fish and 360 species of coral.

BDI.description: Burundi is a landlocked country in East Africa.
The official languages of Burundi are Kirundi and French.
Burundi has one of the lowest per capita GDPs in the world.
Mount Heha, located in Burundi, is the highest mountain in the country at 2,685 meters (8,809 ft).

GUY.description: Guyana is the only English-speaking country in South America.
Guyana is known for having one of the largest unspoiled rainforests in South America, covering over 80% of the country.
Guyana is home to the world's largest single drop waterfall by volume, Kaieteur Falls, which is four times taller than Niagara Falls.
Guyana is the second smallest country in South America, after Suriname.

SJM.description: Svalbard and Jan Mayen are two separate territories of Norway located in the Arctic Ocean.
Svalbard is home to the Global Seed Vault, which stores millions of seeds from crops and plants around the world.
Jan Mayen is an uninhabited volcanic island with no permanent settlements, but is occasionally visited by Norwegian military personnel.

Svalbard has a unique polar night phenomenon where the sun doesn't rise above the horizon for several months during the winter, and a midnight sun phenomenon where the sun doesn't set for several months during the summer.

BFA.description: Burkina Faso is a landlocked country located in West Africa, bordered by six countries: Mali, Niger, Benin, Togo, Ghana and Ivory Coast.
The official language of Burkina Faso is French, however, there are more than 60 languages spoken throughout the country.
The population of Burkina Faso is approximately 21 million people, with a majority of the population being concentrated in rural areas.
Burkina Faso is known for its vibrant music and dance scene, with traditional instruments such as the balafon and djembe being popular in performances.

ZMB.description: Zambia is a landlocked country located in Southern Africa.
The Victoria Falls, one of the largest waterfalls in the world, is located on the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe.
The Zambian kwacha is the official currency of Zambia.
The national animal of Zambia is the African Fish Eagle.

SLE.description: Sierra Leone is located in West Africa and is bordered by Guinea to the north and Liberia to the southeast.
The country gained independence from Britain on April 27, 1961.
Sierra Leone is known for its beautiful beaches and wildlife, including endangered species like chimpanzees and pygmy hippos.
The capital city of Sierra Leone is Freetown, which was founded in 1792 by freed slaves from Britain and America.

GBR.description: The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
The official language of the United Kingdom is English, but other languages like Welsh and Gaelic are also spoken in certain regions.
The currency used in the United Kingdom is the pound sterling.
The Union Jack is the national flag of the United Kingdom, which combines elements of the flags of England, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.

AIA.description: Anguilla is a British Overseas Territory in the Caribbean.
The island has a population of approximately 15,000 people.
Anguilla's main source of income comes from its tourism industry.
The official language of Anguilla is English.

GLP.description: Guadeloupe is an insular region of France located in the Caribbean.
The official language of Guadeloupe is French, but a creole patois is also spoken by locals.
The economy of Guadeloupe relies heavily on tourism and agriculture, particularly sugar cane and bananas.
Guadeloupe is made up of several islands, including Basse-Terre, Grande-Terre, and Marie-Galante.

LBN.description: Lebanon is located in the Middle East and borders Syria and Israel.
The official language of Lebanon is Arabic, but French and English are also widely spoken.
Lebanese cuisine is known for its use of fresh ingredients, spices, and herbs. Popular dishes include hummus, tabouleh, and shawarma.
Lebanon's economy relies heavily on the services sector, particularly banking and tourism.

ISL.description: Iceland is the most sparsely populated country in Europe with only 3 people per km².
The national language of Iceland is Icelandic, which has remained relatively unchanged since the 12th century.
Iceland is home to a large number of active volcanoes, with over 30 volcanic systems and around 130 volcanoes.
Icelandic people consume more Coca-Cola per capita than any other nation in the world.

JOR.description: Jordan is an Arab country in Western Asia.
The capital and largest city of Jordan is Amman.
One of Jordan's most famous landmarks is the ancient city of Petra, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Jordan is home to the Dead Sea, which is the lowest point on Earth.

NFK.description: Norfolk Island is a small island in the Pacific Ocean between Australia, New Zealand, and New Caledonia.
It has a population of around 1,750 people, who are descendants of the mutineers from the HMS Bounty and their Tahitian companions.
Norfolk Island is an external territory of Australia, but it is self-governing with its own legislative assembly.
The economy of Norfolk Island relies heavily on tourism, with visitors attracted by the island's beaches, natural beauty, and historic sites.

JAM.description: Jamaica is an island nation located in the Caribbean Sea.
The national language of Jamaica is English, but many Jamaicans also speak Patois (a Creole language).
Jamaica is famous for its music styles, including reggae, ska, and dancehall.
Jamaica has a diverse cuisine influenced by African, European, and Asian cultures. Popular dishes include jerk chicken, ackee and saltfish, and curry goat.

SGP.description: Singapore is a sovereign island city-state in Southeast Asia.
The country has a very high standard of living and is one of the safest places in the world.
Singapore is known for its multicultural population and food scene.
The country has a highly developed economy and is a global hub for finance, technology, and shipping.

MRT.description: Mauritania is a country in northwest Africa that borders the Atlantic Ocean on its west coast.
The country has a population of around 4.5 million people.
Mauritania is home to the Banc d'Arguin National Park, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and an important breeding ground for migratory birds.
The country's official language is Arabic, but French is also widely spoken as a second language.

SHN.description: The territory is made up of three separate islands: Saint Helena, Ascension Island, and the remote Tristan da Cunha group of islands.
It is a British Overseas Territory, with Queen Elizabeth II as its head of state.
Saint Helena is famous for being the location where Napoleon Bonaparte was exiled from 1815 until his death in 1821.
Tristan da Cunha is one of the most remote inhabited islands in the world, located over 2,000 km from the nearest mainland.

GNB.description: Guinea-Bissau is a country located in West Africa.
The official language of Guinea-Bissau is Portuguese.
Guinea-Bissau is known for its diverse wildlife and is home to several national parks and nature reserves.
Music and dance play an important role in the culture of Guinea-Bissau, with traditional styles like gumbe and kundé being popular.

MYS.description: Malaysia is a Southeast Asian country consisting of two regions separated by the South China Sea - Peninsular Malaysia and East Malaysia (Borneo).
The capital city of Malaysia is Kuala Lumpur, which is also the largest city in the country.
Malaysia is known for its diverse cuisine, which includes Chinese, Indian, and Malay influences.
The Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur were once the tallest buildings in the world and remain the tallest twin towers.

GIN.description: Guinea is a country in West Africa.
The official language of Guinea is French.
Guinea has significant deposits of bauxite and gold.
The musical style of Guinea is known for its use of the balafon, a type of wooden xylophone.

GRD.description: Grenada is an island country located in the Caribbean Sea.
The capital city of Grenada is St. George's.
Grenada is known as the 'Island of Spice' due to its production and export of spices such as nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves.
Grenada is home to Grand Anse Beach, which is considered one of the most beautiful beaches in the world.

LUX.description: Luxembourg is the only Grand Duchy in the world.
The country has three official languages: Luxembourgish, French, and German.
Luxembourg is the richest country in the European Union measured by gross domestic product (GDP) per capita.
The Ardennes forest covers approximately one third of the country's total area.

MWI.description: Malawi is a landlocked country in southeastern Africa.
Lake Malawi, one of the largest lakes in the world, lies on the eastern border of the country.
The official language of Malawi is English, but Chichewa is also widely spoken.
Agriculture is the main industry in Malawi, with over 80% of the population working in this sector.

VNM.description: Vietnam is located in Southeast Asia and shares borders with China to the north, Laos to the northwest, Cambodia to the southwest, and the South China Sea to the east.
Ho Chi Minh City (formerly known as Saigon) is the largest city in Vietnam, with a population of over 8 million people.
Vietnam is the world's largest producer of cashew nuts and black pepper.
The Vietnamese language uses a modified version of the Latin alphabet called Quoc Ngu, which was developed in the 17th century by French Jesuit missionaries.

AUS.description: Australia is the world's sixth-largest country by total area.
The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, is located off the coast of Australia.
Australia has a diverse range of flora and fauna, including many unique species such as kangaroos, koalas, and wallabies.
The Sydney Opera House, located in Sydney, Australia, is one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.

EGY.description: Egypt is the most populous country in North Africa and the Arab world
The Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, is located in Egypt
Egypt is home to the Nile River, which is the longest river in the world
Cairo, the capital city of Egypt, is one of the largest cities in Africa and the Middle East

ZWE.description: Zimbabwe is a landlocked country located in southern Africa.
The official language of Zimbabwe is English, but many people also speak Shona or Ndebele.
Victoria Falls, one of the world's largest waterfalls, is located on the border between Zimbabwe and Zambia.
Zimbabwe was once known as Rhodesia, named after British colonizer Cecil Rhodes.

IDN.description: Indonesia is the world's largest island country with over 17,000 islands.
The official language of Indonesia is Indonesian, which is based on the Malay language.
Indonesia is home to the world's largest Muslim population, with Islam being the predominant religion in the country.
The cultural heritage of Indonesia has been shaped by numerous influences, including Hinduism, Buddhism, and Dutch colonialism.

SMR.description: San Marino is the world's oldest surviving sovereign state and constitutional republic
San Marino is completely landlocked by Italy and is one of the smallest countries in the world
San Marino has a strong economy based on finance, banking, and tourism
San Marino is known for its beautiful medieval architecture and stunning mountain scenery

AGO.description: Angola is located in southwestern Africa, bordered by Namibia to the south, Democratic Republic of the Congo to the north, and Zambia to the east.
The official language of Angola is Portuguese, which was introduced during colonial rule.
Angola has a rich musical heritage, with traditional music styles like semba and kizomba gaining international recognition in recent years.
The oil industry accounts for a significant portion of Angola's economy, with the country being a member of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC).

PRK.description: North Korea is a country located in East Asia.
The country has a one-party state government led by the Workers' Party of Korea.
North Korea has been under economic sanctions due to its nuclear weapons program.
The country's capital city is Pyongyang.

FJI.description: Fiji is an island country located in the South Pacific Ocean.
The official languages of Fiji are English, Fijian and Hindi.
Fiji is home to many stunning beaches and coral reefs, making it a popular tourist destination.
Rugby union is the most popular sport in Fiji and the national team, known as the Flying Fijians, has achieved significant success on the international stage.

GHA.description: Ghana is located on the west coast of Africa and it borders Togo to the east, Ivory Coast to the west, Burkina Faso to the north, and the Gulf of Guinea to the south.
Ghana is known for its rich cultural heritage, with over 100 ethnic groups present in the country. The Akan people are the largest ethnic group in Ghana.
Ghana is one of the world's largest producers of cocoa beans, with cocoa being the second largest export commodity after gold.
Kwame Nkrumah, who led Ghana to independence from Britain in 1957, was the first president of Ghana and a leading figure in the African independence movement.

DNK.description: Denmark is a Scandinavian country located in Northern Europe.
The Danish monarchy is one of the oldest in the world, dating back to the 10th century.
Copenhagen, the capital city of Denmark, is known for its beautiful architecture, canals, and bike-friendly streets.
Denmark is known for its high standards of living, social welfare programs, and strong economy.

ERI.description: Eritrea is located in the Horn of Africa, bordered by Sudan to the west, Ethiopia to the south, and Djibouti to the southeast.
The capital city of Eritrea is called Asmara, which was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2017 for its unique architecture and urban development.
Eritrea has a diverse population of around 5.5 million people, with nine recognized ethnic groups and several languages spoken throughout the country.
Eritrea gained independence from Ethiopia in 1993 after a long struggle for self-determination, and today it is a one-party state with a mixed economy.

ARM.description: Armenia is a landlocked country in the South Caucasus region of Eurasia.
The Armenian Genocide, which took place during World War I, resulted in the deaths of an estimated 1.5 million Armenians.
Armenia is home to Mount Ararat, which is considered the national symbol of the country.
The Armenian language has its own unique script, called the Armenian alphabet.

CHL.description: Chile is the longest country in the world from north to south.
Chile is one of the world's largest producers of copper.
Easter Island, a territory of Chile, is home to over 900 monumental statues called moai.
The Atacama Desert in Chile is one of the driest places on Earth.

TTO.description: Trinidad and Tobago is a twin-island country located in the southern Caribbean Sea.
It is known for its Carnival celebrations, which are among the largest and most popular in the Caribbean.
The economy of Trinidad and Tobago is heavily dependent on oil and gas exports.
Trinidad and Tobago is home to one of the world's largest natural gas processing facilities, the Atlantic LNG plant.

ARG.description: Argentina is the eighth largest country in the world.
The tango was born in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Argentina is known for its beef and is one of the world's largest producers of wine.
The Iguazu Falls, located on the border between Argentina and Brazil, are one of the largest waterfalls in the world.

KWT.description: Kuwait is a small country located at the northern tip of the Persian Gulf, bordered by Iraq and Saudi Arabia.
Kuwait City is the capital and largest city of Kuwait.
Kuwait has a high-income economy and is considered a regional financial hub.
Kuwait is known for its oil reserves, which account for over 90% of its export revenues.

LCA.description: Saint Lucia is an island nation located in the eastern Caribbean Sea
The Pitons are two volcanic spires that are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a major tourist attraction in Saint Lucia
English is the official language of Saint Lucia
The national dish of Saint Lucia is green figs and saltfish

BES.description: The Caribbean Netherlands is made up of three islands: Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba.
The official currency of the Caribbean Netherlands is the US dollar.
The population of the Caribbean Netherlands is around 26,000 people.
The highest point in the Caribbean Netherlands is Mount Scenery on the island of Saba, which stands at 887 metres (2,910 feet) tall.

GIB.description: Gibraltar is a British Overseas Territory located at the southern tip of the Iberian Peninsula.
The Rock of Gibraltar, a monolithic limestone promontory, dominates the territory's landscape.
Gibraltar has a population of approximately 34,000 people and covers an area of just over 6.7 square kilometers.
Gibraltar is known for its strategic location at the entrance to the Mediterranean Sea and its role as a naval base throughout history.

PAN.description: Panama is a country located in Central America, bordering both the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean.
The Panama Canal is a famous engineering marvel that connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. It was completed in 1914.
Panama is known for its rich biodiversity, with over 10,000 species of plants and animals found within its borders.
The Panamanian currency is called the Balboa, but it is officially linked to the US dollar and has the same value.

CHN.description: China is the world's most populous country with a population of over 1.4 billion people
The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles
China is the second-largest economy in the world, with a GDP of over $14 trillion
The Chinese invented paper, gunpowder, printing, and the compass

SWZ.description: Eswatini is a landlocked country in Southern Africa.
Eswatini is the smallest country in continental Africa.
Eswatini is known for its traditional Swazi culture and has many festivals throughout the year.
Eswatini's economy is heavily dependent on agriculture, with over 70% of the population engaged in subsistence farming.

ESP.description: Spain is located in southwestern Europe and shares borders with Portugal, France, Andorra, and Morocco.
The official language of Spain is Spanish, but there are also several co-official regional languages such as Catalan, Basque, and Galician.
Spain is known for its diverse and delicious cuisine, including paella, tapas, and chorizo.
Spain is home to many famous landmarks and attractions, such as the Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, the Alhambra in Granada, and the Prado Museum in Madrid.

AZE.description: Azerbaijan is located in the South Caucasus region of Eurasia, bordered by Russia to the north, Georgia to the northwest and Armenia to the west.
The official language of Azerbaijan is Azerbaijani, which is a Turkic language spoken by around 92% of the population.
Azerbaijan is known for its rich cultural heritage, including music, dance, art, and literature. It is also home to several UNESCO World Heritage sites.

Azerbaijan has significant oil and gas reserves, making it an important player in the global energy market. The country is also working to diversify its economy and develop other industries such as tourism and agriculture.

BEL.description: Belgium is located in Western Europe and is bordered by France, the Netherlands, Germany, Luxembourg, and the North Sea.
The official languages of Belgium are Dutch, French, and German.
Belgium is known for its chocolate, beer, and waffles.
Brussels, the capital of Belgium, is also considered the capital of the European Union.

SRB.description: Serbia is a country located in the Balkans of Southeast Europe.
The official language of Serbia is Serbian, which is written in Cyrillic script.
Belgrade, the capital city of Serbia, is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in Europe.
The Serbian economy is largely dominated by the service sector, followed by industry and agriculture.

IOT.description: The British Indian Ocean Territory is an overseas territory of the United Kingdom located in the Indian Ocean.
The territory includes the Chagos Archipelago, which consists of over 50 islands and islets.
The territory has no indigenous population, but was home to a community of Chagossians until the late 1960s.
The largest island in the territory is Diego Garcia, which serves as a joint military base for the United States and United Kingdom.
